### Preview in All Active Browsers == OmniWeb is commented out as I can't test it Please confirm that it is working ### v1.0. 2005-03-29 ### ### CONFIG OPTION:: Set the TM_PROJECT_SITEURL in your TM Project Window Info Button in the following form: [ http://your.site.ext/ ] ###
# 1. Check if we have a SITE_URL or not if [ "$TM_PROJECT_SITEURL" != "" ] then # Yes, we do have a SITE URL defined, so we need to work out which subdir we're in, if any TM_SubDirs=`echo $TM_FILEPATH | sed "s|^$TM_PROJECT_DIRECTORY/\(.*\)$TM_FILENAME\$|\1|"` #echo Debug::TM_SUBDIR value "$TM_SubDirs" activeURL=$TM_PROJECT_SITEURL$TM_SubDirs$TM_FILENAME #echo Debug::TM_SUBDIR value "$activeURL" else # No, we don't have a SITE URL activeURL=file://$TM_FILEPATH #echo Debug::TM_SUBDIR value "$activeURL" fi # 2. Now check if any browser is running, if so open a new window ## Safari [[ $(ps -xc|grep Safari) ]] && printf "set theActiveURL to "$(echo $activeURL)" 
 tell application "Safari" 
 activate 
 set the URL of document 1 to theActiveURL 
 end tell" | osascript ## FireFox [[ $(ps -xc|grep -i firefox) ]] && printf "set theActiveURL to "$(echo $activeURL)" 
 tell application "Firefox" 
 activate 
 Get URL theActiveURL inside window 1 
 end tell" | osascript ## Internet Explorer [[ $(ps -xc|grep "Internet Explorer") ]] && printf "set theActiveURL to "$(echo $activeURL)" 
 tell application "Internet Explorer" 
 activate 
 OpenURL theActiveURL toWindow 0 Flags 1 
 end tell" | ## OmniWeb Uncomment the next line to make it work ##[[ $(ps -xc|grep -i OmniWeb ) ]] && printf "set theActiveURL to "$(echo $activeURL)" 
 tell application "OmniWeb" 
 activate 
 to GetURL theActiveURL 
 end tell" | osascript ### end
